normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting

unnormalised: Inventory forecasting, a crucial aspect of modern supply chain management, is gaining traction among Indian manufacturers to minimize waste and optimize production. Professor Sharma from IIT-Delhi recently highlighted its importance at the "Make in India" conference on 26/01/2024, stating, "Accurate forecasting reduces unnecessary inventory holding costs and prevents stockouts, boosting overall efficiency."

unnormalised: Companies like Tata Steel are leveraging sophisticated AI-powered tools to predict demand fluctuations for their various steel products, considering factors like festive seasons (Diwali, Dussehra) and fluctuating raw material prices. A recent report suggests that implementing robust forecasting models can reduce holding costs by 15-20% for SMEs by Q3 2024. Many small businesses are now attending workshops organized by the MSME ministry, held every Tuesday at 14:00 hrs, to learn about implementing affordable forecasting solutions. The next session is scheduled for 12/03/2024. Successfully adopting these techniques allows manufacturers to meet customer demand effectively and remain competitive in the dynamic Indian market.
